title: HPI Spencer
content: Precious Myles Garrett, a right-hand dominant children's social worker, presents with left wrist pain that is more bothersome than the masses. The pain wakes her up at night and she is seeking treatment options. She was previously treated by Dr. Ishimori and diagnosed with a left first dorsal compartment wrist cyst, left thumb MCP osteophyte, and bilateral thumb and MCP joint involvement. The masses have been stable in size over time. She has seen her rheumatologist who performed x-rays and an ultrasound of the wrist. She is here for evaluation and treatment of the wrist pain and associated masses.

title: Musculoskeletal
content: Left upper extremity skin is clean during check without anthraea maracunasis. There is a pea-sized mass over the first dorsal compartment. No tenderness or location over the mass. It is mobile and non-tender. Negative Finklestein, no pain with resisted thumb extension. Um, there is a mass at the dorsal ulnar aspect of the thumb MCP joint that is non-mobile and very minimally tender, excellent range of motion at the thumb MCP. No tenderness or location at the A1 point, no locking or catching.

content: Outside x-rays show an osteophyte at the thumb MCP joint. Ultrasound demonstrates a bony avulsion fragment versus osteophyte at the dorsal aspect of the MCP joint of the thumb. Ultrasound of the wrist shows a retinacular cyst superficial to the first dorsal compartment sheath.
